column3: For full documentation see TFunction record in the Functions.pas file
Lines will be ignored if they begin with a semicolon, or if Operation column is empty
Terminate the file with 'END' in capitals in first column

column13: Notes
Absolute value (i.e. if Value is negative returns -Value, otherwise returns Value). No effect on unsigned types.
Param2 for Inc and Dec must be an integer constant expression. Error checking for this is hard coded in ParseFuncCall unit

Decrement Variable by Count. Count may be negative, in which case functions as Inc. Count must be an integer constant expression. No runtime underflow or overflow checking is performed. Generates a sequence of DEC or INC opcode(s), therefore Count should not be large! Does not return a value (contrast with Pred) and, therefore, cannot be used in expressions

Increment Variable by Count. Count may be negative, in which case functions as Dec. Count must be an integer constant expression. No runtime overflow or underflow checking is performed. Generates a sequence of INC or DEC opcode(s), therefore Count should not be large! Does not return a value (contrast with Succ) and, therefore, cannot be used in expressions
Returns True if Value is odd
Notes
Returns the memory address of Variable (TODO: Const, function, return a typed pointer (vs generic pointer)
Returns high byte of Value. Value must be a 16-bit integer-type (Word, Pointer or Integer)
Returns the highest value of an enumerable type
Highest index of array
Read data from an I/O port. Currently always uses IN C,(C) opcode. IN A,(n) is not yet supported
Returns low byte of Value. Value must be a 16-bit integer-type (Word, Pointer or Integer)
Returns the lowest value of an enumerable type
Lowest index of array
Returns the ordinal value of the item
Write Data to the given I/O port
Read from memory. Result type is that of second parameter, Byte if not specified
Writes Data to the given memory address. NOTE: If Data is a numeric type, always writes a single byte (otherwise data size could be unclear).
Returns the Count'th previous value to the parameter. If used with Count=1 and Overflow checks off generates DEC opcodes.
Converts the value to a pointer
Reads one or more values from input stream
Reads one or more lines from input stream
Returns the (memory) byte size of Type
Returns the (memory) byte size of the Variable. A constant expression can also be passed, but may be ambiguous for numeric types
Returns the Count'th successive value to the parameter. If used with Count=1 and Overflow checks off generates DEC opcodes.
Swaps the high and low bytes of the parameter. Must be a 16-bit integer type (Word, Pointer or Integer)
Writes one or more values to output
Writes zero of more values to output followed by a new line
Notes
Returns the character with the given index
Converts the character to lower case
Returns the element count of an array, character count of a string
Returns the element count of an array, character count of a string
Returns the index of the given character
